exercises.setup_notes: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
exercises.execution_notes: Grip the bar with a wide grip, pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight, and then slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.tier_reasons: Offers a big stretch on your lats, provides smooth even tension throughout the range of motion, feels great, and allows for easy overload by increasing the pin weight.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Targets both the lats and mid traps due to the wide grip and pulling motion.
exercises.selection_reason: The Wide Grip Lat Pull Down is an excellent choice for increasing back width, especially for beginners. It targets the lats effectively, which is crucial for achieving the user's goal of increasing back width. The exercise is also stable and allows for easy progression, making it suitable for someone with less than 3 months of experience.

exercises.setup_notes: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs.
exercises.execution_notes: Grip the bar with a neutral grip, pull the bar down to your upper chest while keeping your back straight, and then slowly return to the starting position.
exercises.tier_reasons: Similar benefits to wide grip pull-downs but with more lat emphasis.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Emphasizes the lats more due to the neutral grip.
exercises.selection_reason: The Neutral Grip Lat Pull Down is selected for its emphasis on the lats, which aligns with the user's goal of increasing back width. The neutral grip provides a slightly different angle of pull, which can help in engaging the lats more effectively. This exercise is also beginner-friendly and allows for controlled progression.

exercises.exercise_name: Half Kneeling One Arm Lat Pull Down
exercises.setup_notes: Kneel on one knee and brace against a bench or your knee for stability.
exercises.execution_notes: Pull the cable down with one arm, focusing on driving the elbow down, and return to the starting position.
exercises.tier_reasons: High stretch, high tension, good feel, and easy to overload. Allows focus on one lat at a time to prevent asymmetries.
exercises.targeted_muscle_parts: Targets the lats with a focus on unilateral development.
exercises.selection_reason: This exercise is chosen for its ability to target the lats unilaterally, which can help in correcting any muscle imbalances. It provides a high stretch and tension, which is beneficial for muscle growth. The unilateral nature of the exercise also makes it suitable for beginners to focus on form and muscle engagement.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start on all fours with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Alternate between arching your back (cat) and dipping it (cow) while breathing deeply.
